net.kuujo.vertigo.network

Interface NetworkConfig

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentConfigurable, Config<NetworkConfig>, ConnectionConfigurable, JsonSerializable

    public interface NetworkConfig
extends Config<NetworkConfig>, ComponentConfigurable, ConnectionConfigurable
    Network configuration.

    The network configuration defines a collection of components (Vert.x modules and verticles) that can be connected together in a meaningful way.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String NETWORK_COMPONENTS
      components is an object defining network component configurations.
      static String NETWORK_NAME
      name is a string indicating the unique network name.
      static String NETWORK_SCOPE
      scope is a string indicating the network cluster scope.

    • Field Detail

      • NETWORK_NAME

        static final String NETWORK_NAME
        name is a string indicating the unique network name. This is the address at which the network will monitor network components. This field is required.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NETWORK_SCOPE

        static final String NETWORK_SCOPE
        scope is a string indicating the network cluster scope. The value can be either local or cluster.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • NETWORK_COMPONENTS

        static final String NETWORK_COMPONENTS
        components is an object defining network component configurations. Each item in the object must be keyed by the unique component address, with each item being an object containing the component configuration. See the ComponentConfig class for component configuration options.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the network name. This is the event bus address at which the network's coordinator will register a handler for components to connect to once deployed.
        Returns:
        The network name.

      • setScope

        NetworkConfig setScope(ClusterScope scope)
        Sets the network scope.
        Parameters:
        scope - The network scope.
        Returns:
        The network configuration.

      • getScope

        ClusterScope getScope()
        Returns the network scope.
        Returns:
        The network scope. Defaults to CLUSTER

      • getComponents

        List<ComponentConfig<?>> getComponents()
        Gets a list of network components.
        Returns:
        A list of network components.

      • getComponent

        <T extends ComponentConfig<T>> T getComponent(String name)
        Gets a component by name.
        Parameters:
        name - The component name.
        Returns:
        The component configuration.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given component address does not exist within the network.

      • hasComponent

        boolean hasComponent(String name)
        Returns a boolean indicating whether the network has a component.
        Parameters:
        name - The component name.
        Returns:
        Indicates whether the component exists in the network.

      • getConnections

        Collection<ConnectionConfig> getConnections()
        Returns a collection of network connections.
        Returns:
        A collection of connections in the network.
